{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:06:39.399
    | text      = So, Jordan, we start off today's episode with some triumphant news for some, some possibly
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:06:50.959
    | text      = US Senator, the oldest US Senator, the longest serving US Senator who just left office last
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = year died this morning.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:02.000
    | text      = Former US Senator Strom Thurmond dies.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:06.079
    | text      = Strom Thurmond, the longest serving Senator in US history died Thursday.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:10.519
    | text      = He was 100.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:13.240
    | text      = So he died in the, I guess, early morning hours yesterday.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:17.439
    | text      = Again, Thurmond died at 9.45 PM local time in a hospital in his hometown of Edgar Field,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:26.120
    | text      = said his son, Strom Thurmond Jr.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:29.199
    | text      = He served as a Senator from South Carolina for 48 years, as both a Democrat and later
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:34.800
    | text      = as a Republican.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:37.560
    | text      = And Strom Thurmond was attacked viciously and endlessly because he wasn't a Democrat
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:43.079
    | text      = and he wasn't a Klan member.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:44.680
    | text      = So he was called a racist.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:46.519
    | text      = If you're a Klan member, if you hate black people, if you try to exterminate them, you're
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:52.560
    | text      = called a member.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:53.560
    | text      = Sir, I have a question.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:54.560
    | text      = You're called a right wing extremist if you care about black people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:07:59.279
    | text      = And so he was attacked.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:00.720
    | text      = He was attacked.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

    | text      = Excuse me, sir.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:02.720
    | text      = He was attacked.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:03.720
    | text      = Excuse me, sir.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:04.720
    | text      = He was attacked.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:05.720
    | text      = He was attacked.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:06.720
    | text      = He wanted slavery back.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:07.720
    | text      = So yeah, I think this is an interesting take on Strom Thurmond and why people would call
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:11.399
    | text      = him a racist.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:12.639
    | text      = Wow.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:13.639
    | text      = This is full of shit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:14.639
    | text      = Yikes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:15.639
    | text      = So for instance, even in the information that Alex provided in just that clip, you might
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:19.439
    | text      = end up like, if that's all you had to go on, you might ask yourself, why did Strom Thurmond
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:23.920
    | text      = go from being a Democrat to being a Republican?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:25.920
    | text      = Why?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:26.920
    | text      = Why didn't Alex get into any of that?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:28.879
    | text      = It seems like something that maybe was a big decision for him.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:31.560
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:32.559
    | text      = I wonder if a lot of people at the same time became, went from being Democrats to becoming
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:37.799
    | text      = Republicans.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:38.799
    | text      = So the short version is that Strom was a huge racist and the Democratic party wasn't racist
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:42.720
    | text      = enough for him anymore.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:43.799
    | text      = Not anymore.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:44.799
    | text      = So the longer version is that in 1956, many Southern Democrats or Dixiecrats as they were
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:49.759
    | text      = known after they went a little rogue in response to Harry S. Truman supporting some civil rights
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:54.039
    | text      = things in the 1948 election.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:08:57.000
    | text      = So these Dixiecrats were really pissed off about the Supreme Court's decision in Brown
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:00.440
    | text      = versus Board of Education, which ruled that racially segregated schools were unconstitutional.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:05.799
    | text      = In response, 112 of the 138 members of Congress from Southern states signed what they called
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:11.759
    | text      = the Southern Manifesto.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:13.740
    | text      = This document insisted that the Supreme Court had no right to meddle in the matters of education.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:17.840
    | text      = And if, you know, states wanted to make it so people of different races had to go to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:21.379
    | text      = separate schools, protecting that right was critically important.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:24.440
    | text      = It's states' rights, Dan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:26.500
    | text      = It's not, it's about the federal system getting out of our business.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:29.960
    | text      = It's important to protect the Constitution.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:32.120
    | text      = Absolutely.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:33.120
    | text      = Right?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:34.120
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:35.120
    | text      = So they pleaded that they should be able to keep their whole separate but equal thing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:37.240
    | text      = going and blamed efforts to desegregate on quote, outside meddlers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:41.879
    | text      = I've never heard that before.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:43.200
    | text      = Totally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:44.200
    | text      = That's so weird that outside meddlers have been, they have been fucking up the progressive
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:48.740
    | text      = movement for so long.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:50.159
    | text      = Very effective over time.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:52.320
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:53.320
    | text      = Undefeated outside meddlers.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:55.320
    | text      = They warned that trying to integrate schools was going to destroy the amicable relations
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:09:59.399
    | text      = between the races.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:00.399
    | text      = Literally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:01.399
    | text      = That's in the Southern Manifesto.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:02.399
    | text      = Oh, of course it is.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:03.399
    | text      = They have to, they have to really gaslight you if you want to, if you want to maintain
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:06.000
    | text      = slavery you've got to really gaslight people.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:08.000
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:09.000
    | text      = They commended the quote, states which have declared the intention to resist forced integration
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:12.879
    | text      = by any lawful means.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:15.519
    | text      = So Strom Thurmond, as a Southern member of the Senate, was a massive fan of segregation
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:19.980
    | text      = and he signed on to the Southern Manifesto.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:21.919
    | text      = Huge fan.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:23.179
    | text      = This was a losing battle he was fighting as the tide was trending towards civil rights
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:27.320
    | text      = but that didn't stop him from really trying fucking hard.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:31.100
    | text      = And that brings us to August 28th, 1957 when Strom Thurmond embarked on the longest filibuster
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:36.720
    | text      = in history attempting to derail the Civil Rights Act of 1957.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:40.799
    | text      = You got it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:41.799
    | text      = A large part of which had to do with protecting black people's right to vote.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:44.679
    | text      = Wow, there is that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:45.679
    | text      = He filibustered for 24 hours and 18 minutes but the bill passed a couple hours after he
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:50.519
    | text      = ran out of steam.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:51.799
    | text      = He achieved essentially nothing except making sure people throughout history would remember
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:55.299
    | text      = him as a record-setting racist.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:10:58.120
    | text      = Flash forward a few years and LBJ had just signed the Civil Rights Act of 1964.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:03.039
    | text      = This was a big one as it outlawed discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:07.259
    | text      = and national origin.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:09.000
    | text      = This covered voting issues, public accommodations, public facilities, education and employment
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:14.019
    | text      = discrimination so as you can easily imagine the racists were really not happy about this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:18.120
    | text      = Oh, they weren't stoked.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:19.120
    | text      = LBJ's assistant Bill Moyers has quoted Johnson as saying, quote, I think we just delivered
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:23.200
    | text      = the South to the Republican Party for a long time to come after he'd signed the bill and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:28.039
    | text      = at the time he couldn't have possibly known how right he was.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:31.600
    | text      = The cracks were there since the Truman administration's embrace of civil rights and this LBJ shit
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:36.399
    | text      = was just too much.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:37.860
    | text      = The Republican Party would soon roll out the Southern strategy, an attempt to win over
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:42.080
    | text      = white southern voters by explicitly appealing to their racism.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:45.779
    | text      = This was essentially the point where the parties completely changed their identities from what
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:49.360
    | text      = they were previously and many of the southern Democrats became Republicans.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:53.960
    | text      = There were still some racist Democrats for sure but a lot of the hardcore folks like
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:11:57.679
    | text      = a guy who would speak for 24 hours straight to try and stop black people from being guaranteed
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:01.700
    | text      = equal voting rights, they just made their jump to the Republican Party.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:05.039
    | text      = That's where they were always meant to be.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:06.879
    | text      = Yep.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:07.879
    | text      = Not to put too fine a point on it but Strom Thurmond is essentially synonymous with racism.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:12.120
    | text      = Even though he did soften as time went on and he would eventually do things like vote
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:16.879
    | text      = in favor of making a holiday in honor of Martin Luther King Jr., his legacy is impossible
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:21.639
    | text      = to separate from his horrible racism at a time when it really mattered a lot.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:26.480
    | text      = The fact that Alex can't even accept this very clear reality of history is an indication
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:12:31.139

    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:32.279
    | text      = The first is that they allow consulates to be able to track and locate people much easier
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:36.160
    | text      = than they would be able to otherwise in the case of like an emergency.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:39.640
    | text      = The second reason is that they are considered valid ID by many states, thus allowing immigrants
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:44.160
    | text      = of any documentation status to apply for a driver's license, and it allows them to pay
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:49.640
    | text      = taxes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:50.640
    | text      = Further, since the matricula card is a valid ID, they allow folks the ability to open bank
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:55.680
    | text      = accounts, which is pretty important.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:21:58.640
    | text      = One thing they don't do is confer any sort of immigration status upon the holder of one
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:03.400
    | text      = of these cards.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:04.660
    | text      = It's just a secure, official, difficult to forge form of identification that makes everyone's
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:09.400
    | text      = life easier, that these guys are super against.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:12.819
    | text      = So essentially, because states and America won't just give people IDs without having
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:18.599
    | text      = already got photo IDs or whatever, this has to exist.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:24.119
    | text      = Because Mexico, it has to exist.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:26.519
    | text      = That's one thing, and then there's a bunch of other reasons too, like the being able
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:30.819
    | text      = to know where citizens of Mexico are, you know, like that kind of thing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:35.319
    | text      = No, no, you'd want to know that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:36.319
    | text      = Alex is interviewing this guy, John Andrews, the then president of the Colorado Senate,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:40.720
    | text      = about a bill he was championing called Colorado House Bill 1224, the Secure and Verifiable
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:46.640
    | text      = Identity Act.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:48.259
    | text      = This act wasn't designed to have the Mexican consulates stop issuing these cards, because
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:52.960
    | text      = that would have been a violation of the 1963 Vienna Convention on Consular Relations.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:22:58.279
    | text      = Instead, this act was aimed at making it so state and local agencies in Colorado could
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:03.039
    | text      = quote only accept secure and verifiable documents, which then was defined as not being these
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:09.640
    | text      = things.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:10.640
    | text      = This was essentially just a bill designed to make immigrants' lives more difficult,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:14.279
    | text      = by doing things like making it so people who have consular ID cards can't use them to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:18.960
    | text      = get driver's licenses or bank accounts.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:21.819
    | text      = Folks like Andrews often try to couch their motivations as being about keeping people
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:25.160
    | text      = safe and making sure that people can't exploit the system, but the reality is that this kind
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:29.480
    | text      = of bullshit hurts a lot more people than just undocumented immigrants, and it would be really
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:33.779
    | text      = naive to imagine that Andrews isn't aware of that.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:36.839
    | text      = In 2006, a report was released by the Brennan Center for Justice titled Citizens Without
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:41.240
    | text      = Proof, which was aimed at analyzing the effect that these restrictions on getting identification
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:46.220
    | text      = have, or have the potential to have, on U.S. citizens themselves.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:51.079
    | text      = They found that 7% of U.S. citizens do not have ready access to the documents that would
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:23:55.799
    | text      = be required to get a driver's license under these new laws, though they would qualify
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:01.079
    | text      = to get one.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:02.079
    | text      = They should get, but they just don't have the documents to get them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:04.519
    | text      = However, this number actually goes up to 12% when you only include people who make under
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:09.400
    | text      = $25,000 a year.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:11.119
    | text      = There you go.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:12.119
    | text      = Additionally, 34% of women of voting age had a document that proved their citizenship,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:17.039
    | text      = but it wasn't something that included their current legal name.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:20.119
    | text      = Oh yeah, well.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:21.119
    | text      = So these are like real difficulties that people who are citizens would have under these restrictions.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:24:29.160
    | text      = Right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker

{{TranscriptBlock

{{TranscriptBlock

    | text      = He believes that there aren't weapons of mass destruction, which is good on him.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:29.119
    | text      = Yeah, fair.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:30.119
    | text      = But he does have some interesting takes that I enjoyed and I looked into a little bit,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:36.719
    | text      = which is kind of fun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:37.719
    | text      = All right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:38.719
    | text      = They reported on the BBC about two months ago that Tariq Aziz, the Iraqi foreign minister,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:45.280
    | text      = was to be paid upwards of four and a half million dollars a year.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:50.519
    | text      = It was almost three million pounds a year, over four million U.S., and that he was going
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:47:55.920
    | text      = to live on a hundred plus thousand acre palace of Prince Charles and was to be given armed
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:04.000
    | text      = bodyguards, helicopter escort, into the shopping centers, into London.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:09.440
    | text      = I mean lavish lifestyle, quote, if he would inform on Saddam's weapons of mass destruction.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:14.719
    | text      = Now, I don't know where that story went.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:16.920
    | text      = Where is Tariq Aziz?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:18.920
    | text      = We hear no discussions of him now.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:21.199
    | text      = They admit they paid off Iraqi Republican Guard leaders before the war in gold bars.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:26.280
    | text      = Gold bars.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:27.280
    | text      = Gold bars.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:28.280
    | text      = So, real quick, the question about Tariq Aziz, I can answer that very easily.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:32.119
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:33.119
    | text      = He was actually also not the foreign minister at this point.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:35.679
    | text      = That was a position he held from 1983 to 1991.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:39.159
    | text      = At the time of the invasion, he was actually the deputy prime minister of Iraq.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:42.639
    | text      = Ah, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:43.639
    | text      = He's a pretty important dude.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:44.639
    | text      = The episode that we're listening to is from June 27th, 2003, and Alex is asking, where
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:48.840
    | text      = is Tariq Aziz?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:50.159
    | text      = As if to imply that he's somewhere enjoying his life or whatever.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:53.079
    | text      = Sure, sure, he's on a tropical beach somewhere.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:54.760
    | text      = No, no, no.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:48:55.760
    | text      = He was captured on April 24th, 2003, and held in Camp Cropper in Baghdad.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:00.119
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:01.119
    | text      = He would remain in custody until June 2015, when he died of a heart attack.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:05.119
    | text      = Ah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:06.119
    | text      = So Alex is super wrong about this one.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:07.119
    | text      = It's good that they let him free after the heart attack.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:09.280
    | text      = Yes, yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:10.280
    | text      = I've heard Alex say that the Iraqi Republican Guard was paid off with gold bars a bunch
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:14.480
    | text      = of times, and I just kind of ignored it because I was like, this is stupid.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:17.280
    | text      = But this time I wanted to dig in and see if I could figure out where this idea came from.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:21.539
    | text      = And I think I did.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:22.539
    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:23.539
    | text      = Apparently, in 2003, some U.S. soldiers in Iraq detained three people that they stopped
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:27.840
    | text      = in a car that they felt might have been heading towards the Iranian border.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:31.420
    | text      = Their probable cause to search them was that, quote, the driver's paperwork and ID didn't
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:35.440
    | text      = match the vehicle registration.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:37.719
    | text      = In the bed of the truck, the soldiers found 999 bars of, quote, crudely made non-minted
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:43.079
    | text      = gold bars that they estimated were worth between 80 and 100 million dollars.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:47.880
    | text      = Nice.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:48.880
    | text      = Good work, guys.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:49.880
    | text      = Obviously, this is weird.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:50.880
    | text      = But to make things even stranger, quote, two days earlier, soldiers stopped another Mercedes
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:49:55.380
    | text      = dump truck on its way towards the Syrian border, hauling a load of 2,000 gold bars that looked
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:00.519
    | text      = very similar to the ones seized on Monday.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:03.360
    | text      = Then, in June, another truck with 1,183 ingots that were suspected to be gold were intercepted
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:10.159
    | text      = by soldiers at a routine checkpoint.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:12.440
    | text      = Ooh-hoo-hoo!
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:13.440
    | text      = This is very exciting stuff.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:15.880
    | text      = So these would definitely not be gold bars that were used to pay someone off.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:20.239
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:21.239
    | text      = Sure, sure, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:22.239
    | text      = Because there was an article in the Chicago Tribune about this that said, quote, these
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:25.199
    | text      = bars aren't pure, like the bouillon found at Fort Knox, but crudely melted bricks of
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:30.840
    | text      = jewelry.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:31.840
    | text      = So, yeah, so it's most likely that they're all a bunch of rich people trying to smelt
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:36.159
    | text      = down their bullshit as they flee the country.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:38.440
    | text      = Well, the leading theory as of June was that the gold was the gold that Saddam Hussein
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:42.559
    | text      = had encouraged Iraqi citizens to donate for his war effort against Iran.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:46.760
    | text      = Quote, rich businessmen, many Iraqis recall, were expected to cough up three to five pounds
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:51.559
    | text      = of gold or face a visit from Hussein's goon squads.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:50:55.440
    | text      = The speculation was that this was a sophisticated and organized group plundering the wealth
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:00.000
    | text      = that Saddam had hoarded.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:01.760
    | text      = That's kind of exciting, you know?
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:03.199
    | text      = Yeah, that's fun.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:04.199
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:05.199
    | text      = In the past, however, there had been some analyses on the gold bars, and it turned out
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:08.519
    | text      = that they weren't actually gold.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:09.920
    | text      = It just looked like it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:10.960
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:11.960
    | text      = From a New York Times article, quote, gold-colored bars seized by American troops in Iraq appear
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:16.000
    | text      = to be melted-down shell casings made mostly of copper rather than gold.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:20.320
    | text      = All right.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:21.320
    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:22.320
    | text      = It was mostly copper and zinc.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:23.320
    | text      = It was mostly copper and zinc.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:24.320
    | text      = Okay.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:25.320
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:26.320
    | text      = If Alex had another source on this story, I'm happy to check it out, but it seems like
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:27.440
    | text      = there's almost certain that this real-life story is the one that he's distorted into
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:31.639
    | text      = being about globalists paying off Ba'ath Party officials and Republican Guard with
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:35.159
    | text      = bars of gold.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:36.159
    | text      = Yeah, I mean, and it's not like the United States didn't pay a shit ton of money and
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:40.960
    | text      = then lose it and never find out where it went.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:44.599
    | text      = Or if they did, they didn't tell anybody that would stop them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:49.159
    | text      = Fair enough.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:50.159
    | text      = You know, that's true, but not the gold bars part.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:52.960
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:53.960
    | text      = Yeah, exactly.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:54.960
    | text      = Not the claim we're assessing.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:55.960
    | text      = No, no, no, no, totally.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:51:56.960
    | text      = It's believable that they lose a shit ton of money for corrupt purposes, but it's not
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:01.920
    | text      = this.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:02.920
    | text      = Yeah.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:03.920
    | text      = Alex has calls at this point, because Glenn Spencer is going to be in in a little bit.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:09.400
    | text      = He takes a call, and this guy is a complete weirdo, and Alex jumps in to some very inaccurate
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:16.440
    | text      = JFK conspiracies.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:17.440
    | text      = Sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:18.440
    | text      = I believe this might sound a little crazy to you, but I believe that President Kennedy
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:22.760
    | text      = was kind of directed by God when he protected the world pretty much from destruction during
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:30.320
    | text      = the Cuban Missile Crisis, and I'd just like to say that I feel in a way that you're kind
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:35.360
    | text      = of the same way by trying to bring out what's happening to the people, that you're being
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:41.760
    | text      = directed by God in the same way to try and save the world, essentially.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:46.960
    | text      = Well I don't think that's strange.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:47.960
    | text      = And I'd just like to say that to you before I end up hearing what I was going to talk
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:51.599
    | text      = about.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:52.599
    | text      = I'd like to comment on that, and then I'll let you go on.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:54.519
    | text      = I don't, look, but I'm not special.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:57.320
    | text      = President Kennedy wasn't special.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:52:58.480
    | text      = We're all led by God in our lives to stand up against evil.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:02.039
    | text      = Yes, because God lived through people, yes.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:03.860
    | text      = This is a test.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:04.860
    | text      = This is just a, this is the junior varsity, the minor leagues here before we go on to
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:14.079
    | text      = you know join the big team, and let me add something.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:19.519
    | text      = Kennedy for all his corruption and his womanizing and all the rest of it, changed his ways at
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:24.800
    | text      = the end, woke up, gave speeches at American University and other areas.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:29.000
    | text      = I have copies of them.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:31.239
    | text      = I have texts from the National Archives, Library of Congress, I love video of this, maybe I
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:35.760
    | text      = can find it, I know it exists, where he warned of a great corrupt influence that had taken
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:39.920
    | text      = over our government.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:41.099
    | text      = Eisenhower warned of the military industrial complex, and Kennedy was a hawk.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:46.719
    | text      = He was pro-war, pro-CIA, pro all this stuff, and then suddenly he cut taxes, said I'm abolishing
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:52.760
    | text      = the Federal Reserve, I'm getting us out of Vietnam, I'm going to scatter the CIA to the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:53:56.679
    | text      = four winds, he wouldn't go along with nuclear war, he said no to the Northwoods plan, the
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:02.880
    | text      = US government plan, to kill American citizens and blame it on foreign enemies.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:06.940
    | text      = When he saw Northwoods in 62, that's when his whole outlook changed, and they assassinated
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:12.559
    | text      = him six months later.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:14.119
    | text      = This is a fun story that Alex is telling about JFK, but it's disconnected from history.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:20.219
    | text      = So one of the things that Alex is doing here is that he's intentionally fudging the timeline
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:24.400
    | text      = of events in order to create the appearance that things are more connected than they are.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:29.460
    | text      = Operation Northwoods was crafted and presented to JFK's Secretary of State Robert McNamara
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:33.920
    | text      = on March 13th, 1962, who then briefed President Kennedy.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:38.840
    | text      = Alex is claiming that six months later Kennedy was assassinated, but that didn't happen until
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:42.599
    | text      = November 1963.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:44.920
    | text      = You know, it wouldn't sound as compelling if it's like he saw Northwoods, and then a
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:47.920
    | text      = year and a half later he was assassinated.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:50.039
    | text      = Yeah, that's a little bit disconnected.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:52.079
    | text      = You compress that timeline and you make-
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:54.159
    | text      = That's very much more suspicious.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:56.079
    | text      = It sounds more like causality.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:57.559
    | text      = Sure, sure, sure.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:54:58.800
    | text      = Alex wants these things to feel closer in time in the audience's mind because that makes
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:02.400
    | text      = it feel like they're connected, or even like one led to the other.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:05.559
    | text      = It's a rhetorical trick and it's a lie.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:07.760
    | text      = As for the other stuff, most of that's not true either.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:11.079
    | text      = Whatever you might say about JFK, one thing you cannot deny is that he was promoting globalism
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:15.619
    | text      = right up to the end.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:17.559
    | text      = On June 10th, 1963, a few months before he was assassinated, Kennedy gave a speech at
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:22.320
    | text      = commencement for American University, which is what Alex was referring to, and it's very
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:26.639
    | text      = easy to find that video if Alex would just look for it.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:29.239
    | text      = The speech was about the hope for reaching world peace.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:32.480
    | text      = Here's a little passage.
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:33.480
    | text      = Quote, some say that it is useless to speak of peace or world law or world disarmament,
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:38.960
    | text      = and that it would be useless until the leaders of the Soviet Union adopt a more enlightened
}}

{{TranscriptBlock
    | name      = Unknown Speaker
    | timestamp = 00:55:42.440
